Reviews.Title: Why didn't they think of this before?
Reviews.Author: Roger L. Phillips "HyperShark"
Reviews.Content: I just got this great, new camera from Nikon and it has been just great.  This falls into the category of "what will they think of next?"  The camera itself is a solid performer for a point and shoot with a slightly better than average 5x zoom which is great for a point & shoot model.  Of course, the projector is the "WOW!" factor.  No more squeezing around the display on the back to show your friends the photos.  The projector is a great way to share your images.  The image quality is not as high as the LCD display, but fine for quick showings.As an artist, I will use this camera to shoot new subjects, then project them onto a canvas so I can transfer the compositions into a painting.Be sure to order the larger Nikon case since the other "S" cases are too small for this model.

Reviews.Title: A one of a kind
Reviews.Author: Warren Flarity
Reviews.Content: I concur with the other 5 star reviews. It is for small groups of 4-5 viewers. It is not as bright as the big boy 2000 lumen, but adequate within its limits. I am also a hobby artist, with the projector I can store comps, project, and rough out line art. This alone makes it worth the purchase. The innards are state-of-the-art, as good as any other 12meg pix P&S.; There is a lot of undiscovered potential lurking within. One drawback is that the only input to the projector is via the camera. somewhere, somebody will hack the file format on the SD card so you can load your other pictures for projection.  I'll then give it 6 stars.Update:  here is a software that converts jpeg from other sources to Nikon coolpix s1000pj format that can be saved on SD card and viewed with the built in projector.  [...]. it works with other models and mfg's formats. Now I give it 6 stars. I can convert my powerpoint training slides for projection on the s1000pj, and carry it in my shirt pocket, now that's cool!

Reviews.Title: Photos aren't sharp enough for a product this expensive
Reviews.Author: R. Gale
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas, so I've been using it for 2+ weeks.  Yes, the projector is very cool.  And the wideness of the lens is great.  The flash recharges fairly quickly.  But the photos I've taken with it aren't as sharp as those from the Casio Exilim camera I got 3 years ago.  And at the end of the day for me, sharp photos are more important than bells and whistles.  Also, the lens is in the upper right corner of the camera instead of dead center which is where the projector is (a strange design choice), so you have to be careful how you hold it so you don't get the edge of your finger in the image.  The flash is very bright, so you can't be too close to your subject when using it -- it washes out the image.  And because the lens is so wide, I did find myself getting closer to my subjects.  So unless you have some urgent need for the projector feature, I can't recommend this camera, especially given how expensive it is.  I've gone back to using my Casio camera...which is also lighter and easier to stick in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Nikon $149 camera w/ projector ... just buy it and enjoy the fun
Reviews.Author: insandiego
Reviews.Content: This is a $149 camera with a projector.  Keep this price in mind as you read my review or any reviews about this camera.  I own other compact cameras before but this one pushed me to write a review... it's that special!1) What will the projector do for you and does it really work?Yes, it really works.  It's really a fun and convienient accessory built into this camera.  You will be the star of the party when you start to shine photos and videos on the wall or any white surface nearby, I guarantee it.  The brightness all depends the distance from where you are to the wall or how dark the room is.  In a dimly lit party room or bed room, it's plenty bright enough for a 40 inch picture. In brighter rooms, then just make the image smaller down to about 10-20 inches, which is still way larger than the tiny 3 inch LCD on the camera to share photos with friends.  You might just be a bit nervous when strangers start to crowd around when you start your public slide show.2) Over all impression of the s1000pj = A+This is the camera to have handy to just have fun.  The s1000pj was a $500 camera a year ago and not worth it's price, but now at less than $150, there's no reason not to get it.  The s1000pj camera captures good enough pictures that would fit for any photo album or webpage or even reasonable enlargements to 11x14.  Seriously, who has the wall space to hang so many pictures on their walls?  Some people complain these small cameras are never good enough to do giant enlargements... to hang where? If you have the need for larger pictures then use a $1000 DSLR camera with a good lens.  Enough said here.3) Picture quality = AWhat I am saying is that for this small size camera at this price range, you just have to ENJOY your camera and ENJOY the images you capture.  No doubt there are other better cameras but with a projector?  This s1000pj camera works very well in daylight or well lit room.  In dimmer situations, the flash works well.  Without flash, well ofcourse the ISO will have to be little higher so expect some noise; it's not that bad, imho.  I really see that most people don't understand the value/compact camera and noise correlation.  Ask yourself what you use the camera for and buy the right camera for the purpose as priority #1, and make your budget priority #2.  Lastly, what should the camera do for you?  Make you a famous photographer or just to have fun and capture the images and share with family and friends?4) Build quality and useabilty = A+Nikon has worked wonders with this little camera.  Compressing the lens and a projector inside a very compact camera about the size and weight of a deck of cards.  I don't think it's bulky but some people say it is not factoring in that other smaller compact cameras don't have a projector!  With that said, the Nikon s1000pj feels solid and safe with a built in lens protector.  The lens is all internal and so no protruding lens to worry about while using it.  The camera is easy to use without weird complicated settings to worry.  The auto or pre-set Scene Selection works well enough for me.  Ok... people who complain this doesn't have all the manual settings and customization for experienced photography... GO GET A DSLR CAMERA FOR REAL TRUE PHOTOGRAPHY SETTINGS and ACTION!5) What are bad points?For about $149, this Nikon s1000pj camera does not have any negatives.  Really folks, people complain too much and want way to many things for free.  This camera will work just fine and does a special projection that no other cameras in this price have.  If I had to have something bad to say about the Nikon s1000pj is that the battery could be twice as big making the camera a little thicker so the projection time could be longer... oh I forgot, I guess I could just buy extra batteries!  The battery charger is external so you can charge while using the camera (other cameras you must charge battery inside it.----//----It's your money, it's your choiceIt's my money, then it's my choiceGot no money?, then get a job already!- anonymous

Reviews.Title: The Projector is the Great
Reviews.Author: Chris Lawrenson
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, easy to use, turns on quick, everything is great.You have to adjust the focus on the projector manually which is not a big deal, very easy to do, the adjustment is well placed on the top of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S1000pj
Reviews.Author: Joe Hubler
Reviews.Content: great camera, fast auto focus, good low-light focus.I am just disappointed with the battery life, I have 2 other compact cameras, one is also a Nikon, they both have much better battery life.i highly recommend you get 2 or 3 extra batteries. Other than that you will love this camera!get a big memory card too, 4 or 8 gig!

Reviews.Title: It's a hit!
Reviews.Author: tilly
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for my husband for Christmas.  He totally loved it!  The instructions were easy for him to follow.  In less than 24 hours he felt completely at ease with using this camera.  The pictures are great.  Everyone loved the projector feature!!  He spent his holiday season taking pictures of everyone and then displaying them on the wall.  The projector pictures looked as good as the photo pictures.  I am not sure how a professional photographer would review this product.  I am sure we will enjoy taking (and showing) lots of family pictures for years to come!

Reviews.Title: You might steal the show, while the batts allow you
Reviews.Author: CANNON
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the unique feature for the price of a conventional 12 MP.Before buying this, please consider:Having a tiny projector is not that usefull after all, but the camera is still a good buy.Have in mind that abusing of the projector will shorten batt (duh) and when the bulb life runs over, will there be a replacement available, for a reasonable price?I did thought that out and still clicked on the buy button.after i received it:I does not feels that heavy for me, as previous reviews mentioned; for starting.But I am still concerned of having the projector glass exposed, in contrast to the camera lens that has it own auto cover. Prev reviews also mentioned.ok, good, now lets go for a field test, here are the results:-Battery duration, stabilizer, and std features are good enough.-The zoom is fast and accurate on the focus, the shooter speed is outstanding, maybe a little delay between video-play/project-photo mode, but is still acceptable.-it will heat when the projector is turned on for a while, just make sure to place it on a vent. area or near a fan, and be brief.-The design of the camera is neat enough to keep the heat away from where you place your fingers, still be carefull.-It also arrives with a small stand block to use for projections and a remote, just make sure to keep your instant expo below 6 mins, lets say.In conclusion: I bought it, been using it for 1 1/2 week and recommend it, for family gatherings, and amateurs.P.S.: One last thing: You have to remove the battery and place it on a separate charger, not my preferred way. In case you prefer the integrated chargers, you've been warned.

Reviews.Title: Make them smile!
Reviews.Author: Diane Johnson
Reviews.Content: This is sure fun at a wedding reception, take a picture and project it on the table cloth! It brings out the smiles. And its just a darned good camera, easy to use, logical functions and you wind up with really good pictures.

Reviews.Title: What a delightful surprise!
Reviews.Author: High-tech redneck
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise the s1000 with the projector is. It is better than imagined and is a wonderful asset for work. I can photograph a client and show that picture up on the wall almost immediately.I had read the reviews which were very positive but was still blown away by how handy the projection feature is. I highly recommend it, everyone is dazzled.

Reviews.Title: Love this little gadget
Reviews.Author: M2G "m2g P34CE"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. Not only is the quality of pictures is awesome, but it has dozens of different modes of pictures and movies. It is very quick. Unlike my other cameras which were more expensive then this, this camera adjusts focus instantly when moving and zooming. Stabilizer is great even for shaky hands. Not to mention this Projector. I mean a projector in camera??? what will they think of next. It is a great quality projector for this price. It is not very bright, and will only look decent in a dark room. In a room with one window open during daytime the image is very hard to see. This is a great party trick and the projection can get really big - like a big screen tv.I love this camera more then my Fujitsu 2000HD that takes HD videos.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera - Period
Reviews.Author: Chandra "csekar15"
Reviews.Content: I am a big Nikon fan and have their DSLR as the main camera and love it. Bought this for everday quick use. The projector feature was a cool feature. But, the camera lacks in image quality big time. If we take pictures in bright light (day light), it performs well. But, any indoor pictures are grainy at any ISO. The pictures look out of focus way too often.Again, I am a huge Nikon fan and this is probably my first review on Amazon. I thought I should take the time and write this only because I feel this is a bad product from their line.

Reviews.Title: Love this Cam
Reviews.Author: Goldilox
Reviews.Content: Fell in love with the features and the fact that it has a remote. The projector is good, please don't expect the type of quality as you would a regular stand alone projector (it's a camera).It is heavy because of the projector.Flash is very bright, will light up a dark roomImage quality is superb even though previews on the cam may not look like much, when you upload them to your comp you will see the details in all their glory.Cons:I don't like taking the battery out to charge itI do wish the shutter speed was a bit fasterOverall I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for showing off videos and pictures
Reviews.Author: Ramses F. "ramsesfb"
Reviews.Content: great camera overall , nice projector feature for showing off pictures , i know its a compact camera projector but it needs to be really dark in the room for it to look really good but i been loving the projector to show pictures without connecting anything

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jean "Jean"
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my husband and he loves it. At first he thought his older camera was fine but when he saw all the features (plus the small size) he fell in love.Priced very well too.

Reviews.Title: A must have for today's On-the-Go family
Reviews.Author: A. Chang
Reviews.Content: What a great camera for the busy family and so much fun for the holiday - where the friends/family can share photo without booting up the PC or unplug/plug into a TV...although the size, resolution and lighting is limited, but the convenience outweights any negative aspect...only concern if the cost of changing the projector light and the battery life...great innovation....

Reviews.Title: projector OK pics poor
Reviews.Author: mark mykituk
Reviews.Content: the projector works OK but pictures and video are poor. not worth the high price international buyers pay once the total price is paid. i was very disappointed with this purchase, i have never paid so much for so little.

Reviews.Title: great camera but broken already
Reviews.Author: Sus
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great camera until today when I was taking important pics and the screen went white. Cant seem to fix it no matter what I do. I have only had this camera since Novemeber.  I have only been using it sporadically for 3 months!

Reviews.Title: Poor images but a cool projector...
Reviews.Author: Rakesh Gowda
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to receive this camera, but I was disappointed with the picture quality. I wanted to give 3 stars, but just because of the projector, gave it 4 overall.Cons:Images - The quality of images clicked indoors and in the night is highly inconsistentBattery - It is fine as long as you do not overuse the projectorZoom- it is very sensitive on use, you wont be able to control easily how much zoom you want!Video - Just OK, nothing greatFlash - Is too bright... it can spoil a good pic at times.Lag : The time taken for the cam to get ready for the next pic in case you are using flash can be disappointing at times, you may miss out on an important picture moment.Pros:Projector -  This is the best part about the camera. The projector works great especially in total darkness(obviously). It is an attention grabber at parties. It would have been great if the projector was a little more brighter.Remote -  I just love the remote and the stand. Just place your camera on the stand and watch your pics and videos from a distance using the remote. you can Zoom in , zoom out, increase/decrease video volume, play/pause videos and the best part is that you can even click pics using the remote, this can be a great feature when you want to use the remote for clicking a group pic without using the self timer.Frankly you will start getting bored with the projector in a few weeks. After all this is a camera first.

Reviews.Title: Average camera, cool projector
Reviews.Author: infogulch
Reviews.Content: The camera itself seems average, it takes decent shots, has a very bright flash, and a decent to good zoom. The battery has something to be desired, but I suppose you can't expect much from a tiny battery powering a theater sized projector. The battery is easily replaceable though and it does seem standard enough that you can find them in the battery section of your supercenter.The camera may be average, but the projector is a party favorite. After taking a few pictures and as the party is winding down, the lights go out and everyone looks up at the makeshift projector screen (aka wall, shades, ceiling, etc) and has a laugh at all the pictures.What's cool is that it actually plays video through the projector with sound. I have yet to load a movie on it and play it through the projector, but I want to try. Perhaps it would sound better if I used the included RCA converter for LR sound on real speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great for sharing
Reviews.Author: Mariely Hernandez "ellebelle"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend and he loved it.  I recorded a video gift card and we were able to take a bunch of pictures of family and friends over the holidays.  When he turned on the projector to show friends at a restaurant and at a party, everyone was very impressed.  Sharing NYE pictures the following day was also very convenient and the projector quality was good.  For sharing during the day, we discovered it was easier to to place some white sheets on the ground and have everyone look down (that's if your curtains don't block out the light very well.  All in all, I think this is a great camera and I know my boyfriend is eager to learn more about it's various features.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Laura "Laura"
Reviews.Content: good camera for the price.  easy to use for a novice.  one problem only:  it is easy to hang your finger over the edge which gets in the way of the frame.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Noone
Reviews.Content: The cameras work very well, but the battery life is too short when I am using the projector. That's the only thing which I dont like.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little camera
Reviews.Author: John P. Salmons
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife who is afraid if my dslr.  Works well, seems to take very good photographs and the projector is a wow factor for others when they see the photos projected on the wall. The zoom is a bit more than normal zooms on these cameras.  My wife is very happy with it and I can take it where I would hesitate taking the dslr for fear of ruining it.

Reviews.Title: Very cool/unique
Reviews.Author: Thomas G. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gets the "wow" vote for uniqueness.  As with most electronics devices, ifGiving as a gift, be extra thoughtful and charge the battery ahead of time as the device is really not ready to use right out of the box.  Also be ready to have a blank wall orWhite sheet or paper on which to project.Overall, very pleased.....

Reviews.Title: The only review you need
Reviews.Author: Ricky
Reviews.Content: My friends this is a spectacular camera anybody that says it isn't is simply nitpicking. The zoom is fine and the low light pictures are fantastic without flash. For the 129.99 price tag this is an outstanding deal. As far as the projector it is not just a gimmick, this thing is fantastic as long as you have the lights a little dim. It was such a big hit at the last party I went to! I would highly recommend this not only for that but the great pictures it takes as well.

Reviews.Title: The best present ever!
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest camera ever. Not only does it have high resolution images and 12.1 megapixels( I think) it also has a built-in-projec'tor that enables u to project your pictures and videos clearly instead of squeezing around the LCD screenjust to see a picture. This camera might be the best christmas present ever( I know it is very early.) Don't believe me? Think I am just joking? Try it out for yourself! It is quite new so don't be surprised if you cannot find it in some stores.

Reviews.Title: zoom near unusable
Reviews.Author: Paul G. Joseph
Reviews.Content: Going by the reviews I bought this camera and it works more or less as advertised EXCEPT for the zoom.  I am unable to control it--I touch it and it either zooms in too close or too far--the zoom control is way too sensitive to the point I don't use it any more.  They do say if ALL YOU WANT is point and shoot this is the camera for you and that is true--you can only point and shoot--you won't be able to zoom in or out in a controlled way so as to frame the picture just right.

Reviews.Title: So - So: High risk of NOT capturing the moment
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am really annoyed that modern digital cameras no longer have a viewfinder.  I have put off buying a camera for a long time, even though my old camera is broken and dying, because I am not interested in a camera without a viewfinder.  I am an avid outdoorsperson, and I cannot see and frame a photo outside in sunshine when using the screen on all the new pocket digitals. It is absurd. But my old camera is broken and needs replacing, and I like the projector feature that started appearing on digitals in the past year, so when this one came up as a "special" on Amazon, I impulsively bought it.The first use was fun; filming an ugly Christmas sweater day at my office.  I got some decent photos and a pretty hilarious video of the office jackass up to his usual hijinks. (I say that lovingly -- he is NOT a jackass but he works overtime to keep us laughing so hence the unfair & inaccurate label). When I went to download the photos to my computer, I was very unimpressed with the camera/computer interface, which did not seem to be intuitive and kept separating still photos from videos and often had me scrambling to find pics I wanted to edit and forward to co-workers.  I did spend some time reading the user's guide, and I believe I have things configured properly on one of my computers to accept the downloads.  I will have to spend some time configuring my laptop and other computer however, to organize the photo and video files.  This seems like too much time to spend for the mediocre results; perhaps I was spoiled by the ease of downloading from my old Sony. I do not see the option to just download photos taken since the last download, and I am too lazy and impatient to pull up all photos every time and have to select individual shots to download. C'est la vie.The other annoyance is that when you take photos longways, you have to rotate them from the camera prior to downloading. What a drag. And there are videos that I shot that way that do not offer the ability to rotate 90 degrees at all. My loss.  My primo video of my funny co-worker dancing with a flashing-lights sweater can only be viewed horizontally. My co-workers are not impressed to get this gem at this angle.The projector feature is fun and was a hit at the office, but the photos I forwarded were not remarkable.  In addition, I have a very steady hand when shooting pictures and videos, but more times than not, I CANNOT seem to get a clear shot of anything moving, even in various modes that are designed for sports or action. At a recent bowling event with a lot of friends, we all took turns trying to get an unblurred photo, trying all shooting modes, and every photo except the still "posed" photos are blurred. There were no photos to commemorate the event on our website because they are all blurred, sometimes eerily. One photo of a guy bowling has swirls in place of his head and hands, but his shirt is crystal clear. What is that about? This has discouraged me from using it.I am also not happy with the need to use the screen to change settings before shots; I much prefer using an external dial or buttons to adjust settings before shooting. Sometimes the glow and beeping of preparing for a shot are too intrusive in terms of light and noise in certain settings, such as when someone is speaking and you are distracting the whole room to set up a simple shot.I am not willing to carry this camera for daily use, and I have not been able to successfully capture the moment more than half the time I have used it.  I am a person who has carried a camera with me every day for years, and I shoot a lot of photos and videos for work and personal use. After owning this camera for nearly 3 months, it is parked at home on a desk, collecting dust.  Luckily, I only paid $120 for this on sale, but it is $120 I would like to have back to apply towards a better camera.  It is an interesting novelty due to the projector feature, but is disappointing as a camera.When (if?) they bring viewfinders back and external dials (like my old Sony), with improved zoom, I will be happy.

Reviews.Title: projector
Reviews.Author: imricksboss
Reviews.Content: its cool. pull it out at a bar. take pics and show them on the ceiling or wall. picture quality is ok. projector has a hard time showing white colors

Reviews.Title: Great for artists
Reviews.Author: Madeleine Watt "Madmadeleine"
Reviews.Content: I use this to speed my sizing and shifting things for planning and sketching my subjects on canvases. Not too difficult to use.

Reviews.Title: Unique Camera, Projector is very unusual, Well Built and innovation remarkable
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S1000pj  is a very interesting and helpful camera when its compact, able to project your pictures and movies onto a wall for others to watch.  The camera is nicely built, well made and design a marvel. Nikon put much thought into this sleek, compact and very functional camera.  The screen can be brightened for outdoor photograhy, the camera also offers low light compensation as well.  Users really need to read the manual and familiarize themselves with the many capabilities as well as experiment with the camera to fully understand its overall features and uses. Its a great over-all camera and interesting from any other camera out there.  Two other models have been created but ratings send interested buyers back to this model, (This is Nikon's first model) which is impressive. I also have the latest model, the S1200PJ and this has some great improvements as well - Larger 3" inch screen, wind filter when shooting video's and a direct video shoot button. The change in its projector bulb to DLP technology, has less heat produced and less power consumption and provides a larger projection size for all to watch. Both cameras are really nice. The S1000PJ has a better feel, built solid compared to the other two models. When switching to Scene Mode, the camera seems to take sharper, crisp photos. Auto Mode may create blurring (some others have reported) . Either camera and model has many features that no other digital camera has to offer. A great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: yiwei
Reviews.Content: i like this camera so much. the pictures are good enough for me, and it is really small. the shape is not perfect, but the functions are good.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Washington "GoOmBaY"
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about 2 years now. I dropped this camera more times than I care to remember. I got it soak by rain, beach water, and a shower (don't ask ) been on a deployment to Afghanistan and 5 Vacation and it still held up pretty nice. Projector still works. Camera still takes nice pictures. I have no complaint. Its a good investment. It can take a beaten and keep on working. I like this little camera. Pictures are excellent and the videos are nice.

Reviews.Title: Awesome pico-projector feature
Reviews.Author: Tetsu Noguchi "tekkster"
Reviews.Content: While built-in pico projectors are gradually increasing, at the time I purchased this unit, the concept was still very new.This camera may no longer be a hot commodity, but when I purchased it for my wife, she immediately started using the pico projector feature and loves it.The camera takes great pictures for a compact, but when taking pictures in the evening, at a bar, and being able to project it on a wall, the novelty factor doesn't wear off easily.  And even better, it's popular over and over again.You might think something like this is a cheezy novelty that quickly wears off and is useless overall.  But this isn't true at all.  While there are some serious problems with this, like very low lumens, and a low resolution, that is offset easily by the simple fact that you can take pictures, shine it on a wall immediately, and show images to multiple people and laugh about those photos instantly.It's hard to beat and this is a feature I hope more cameras incorporate as a differentiator from smart phones.  While there are a few smart phones that have integrated pico-projectors, I highly doubt this feature will catch on quickly as the battery drain must be phenomenal.  and it's features like this that would really make me want to get another compact camera.  As, after all, if you don't feel the need to take the compact camera, you won't bring it out as often, and let's face it, once you get used to your smartphone camera, what's the point of adding another gadget to the mix?

Reviews.Title: Great concept, everyone loves my cam, but...
Reviews.Author: V S "Developed a $6 OBD1 Handheld in 1986"
Reviews.Content: CONS:Easy to get fingers in front of lens.Cant turn off viewscreen/doesnt have dim feature, so even in bright sun you cant see the screen and you're draining your battery like mad.25-minute movie mode - TERRIBLE LIMIT.Too many screens to navigate through, difficult to remember where something is in the menus.Lack of documentation - as far as what it can do, what it can take.Pros:-the $3 generic batteries on amazon work amazingly great. Not as good as original, but that's because they are lower capacity.

Reviews.Title: This is a Cool Camera!
Reviews.Author: all4me
Reviews.Content: We loved this camera on our trips and the projector is a great discussion piece! We use it at all of our family get togethers, reminds me of when we were kids! Works great! Some times the pictures arent the best, but I think its me. I need to mess with it a little more! Over all this is a great buy for the price!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera but projector isn't as neat as it sounds
Reviews.Author: hinesstephens
Reviews.Content: I really liked the idea of a camera with projection to show all the pictures, but the quality of the projection is so poor that we just end up using the little screen on the camera to review pictures anyway.  I wish I wouldn't have spend the extra money for the projection, as I can tell already 1 month into it, that it won't be used.

Reviews.Title: Positive feedback
Reviews.Author: Siddharth
Reviews.Content: Satisfied with the camera performance. Its a handy tool for me to capture all my moments.Satisfied and happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Eric Langevin "Langevinrox"
Reviews.Content: Wify loves it. I was extremely disappointed, until 2 seconds later when i saw that it had a focus. It can project the image a lot bigger than the thing says. It's good. Only con: projector drains the battery rapidly.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix too cool projector camera
Reviews.Author: Highschool Mom
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find this camera to be as amazing as Nikon described it to be. The projector feature is simply fantastic! It is so great to take beautiful digital photos and share them before having to develop them! Everyone who saw our camera could not believe how clear and focused the projected image was. And the price made the camera twice as nice. You will definitely enjoy this hit at any social gathering!

Reviews.Title: Fun camera n perform fine !
Reviews.Author: We Find Gold "Mann"
Reviews.Content: Use it for fun in parties; break ice ...Just buy a second battery.Handy for small group presentation !Well constructed and internal lens is good,also powerful flash.Food scene is an simple white balance adjustment.Amazon price n free delivery is great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Cakistry33
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing,I bought this for my 14 yr old son and he loves it.I will be buying this again for my husband and I too! The projection feature is awesome! It was delivered fast too!

Reviews.Title: Camera with a projector,, CoolPix is really Cool
Reviews.Author: Sachin
Reviews.Content: I brought the Camera for my father as a Christmas gift. The most appealing feature is its projector. Now u can play the slide show on an inbuilt projector equipped with a remote controller. I feel battery life is where the product needs some improvement.Overall I loved the product

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the non-professional. Picture quality is good, the projector feature is fun and on the whole it's easy to use. At the price I bought it at ($139)it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Not terrible, but would not recommend.
Reviews.Author: M. Brent
Reviews.Content: I kept this one in my wish list for a long time until my previous camera, a Casio Exilim, started to wear out. So I decided to go ahead and try it, because the projector feature interested me.The kit I got was a refurb, and came with add-ons like an external flash. I wasn't expecting that, so that was kind of nice (but then, I don't need it either...).The camera itself is solid, and the battery life was decent. It works fairly well and has all the features you would expect. The menu was a little confusing, but they all are. Where it comes down to the wire for me is the performance.All small portable cameras are a bit slow, but compared to the Exilim which I have been carrying for years, this one felt extremely sluggish, and even though my subjects were just walking by I missed more than half the shots I tried to take (and that at wide-angle). The pictures were taken indoors with sunlight coming in the window, but show bad grain as if light was insufficient, and many are out of focus. It's true I did not use the flash but I didn't expect to need to in this scenario, again based on my previous camera.I switched to video mode, which worked well enough. The highest resolution for video is only 640x480, however, and it takes just 24 minutes at a time. (On the plus side, there is no lag after stopping video and you can start the next one almost immediately). Videos are large - a 640x480 high quality video of 24 minutes took almost 1.5GB of space. Windows reports 640x480, 30fps, MJPG video at 8435kbps with 256kbps single-channel PCM audio at 16kHz. I didn't take any video where audio quality was important so I can't say whether it sounded acceptable, but video quality was decent.Better lit, posed still photos came out all right, and the zoom is nice. The camera is also acceptable in terms of size and weight - while it is thicker overall than my Casio was, it matches the thickest part of that camera and the lens does not stick out. I also very much liked the recessed power switch, as I never once turned the camera on in my pocket. ;)The projector gimmick works reasonably well. It definately impresses people to see it - and it's almost a shame you can't load videos and plug in an AC adapter, as doubling as a portable projector would be very nice! But you can't, you are limited to the photos and videos that you take with the camera (though I haven't looked at whether I can fake it ;) ). I had some difficulty getting a video to play with the projector on (I did it once, and another time couldn't work it out. Might have to read the manual. ;) )I did not install the software that came with the camera so I can't speak to whether it is any good.Overall, however, I am a little disappointed. Perhaps I have been spoiled all these years, but this camera feels like a step down to me, and although there is nothing really wrong with it, and the casual photographer may enjoy it, I can't really recommend it in general. I do have an SLR for when I need to take great shots, but I do expect a little more from my pocket camera too.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: the camera exceeded all expectations and was easy to use and reasonably priced.  a really great bargain for beginners and advanced users.

Reviews.Title: camera lived up to reviews
Reviews.Author: Julia Gibson "judi"
Reviews.Content: I saw the camera on Facebook and ordered it for my husband's Christmas present..we went on a Christmas cruise and used it for every picture we took..Matter of fact our other camera broke!! We were thankful for the new camera since we didn't want to use our phone cameras..Phones were turned off and were in the stateroom safe..I love love love this camera

Reviews.Title: Just love my S1000pj ..Awesome !
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I was so excited recieve this in the mail after reading about what this could do.... I love everything about it ... The picture quality is great ! For the price , it is well worth it ... I wish I bought it a week later because then it was selling for 129.00 .. I wanted to buy anither for back up ... I show it to eveyone I know .... they just loved it .... You even can project from 12-15 ft away ..So cool ! So if you read this ... I'm telling you ... this is a gotta have it .thing ....

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera but easy to understand and use
Reviews.Author: hjbrownlee
Reviews.Content: At first I thought the camera would be difficult to understand but for 95% of the pictures I intend to take, it is easy.  It is quite intriguing!  There is no extension of a lens when turned on as in my previous camera.  How Nikon managed that is wonderful.  Of course the projection of pictures for review is unique and very much enjoyed by my family.  I've yet to use the mode where the picture requires faces to be smiling but will determine later if that is real or not.  I bought this camera because Amazon had it on special with a discount larger than the selling price.  I'm not disappointed with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: RockyMama
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas.  It was a big hit, not just with her but with all who have seen it since she's had it.  The projector works surprisingly well and it takes a great photo.  It is compact and with no moving lens pieces seems like it will be a very durable and safe purchase for a teenager. Great buy for the money!

Reviews.Title: coolpix s1000pj
Reviews.Author: allionfm
Reviews.Content: The Nikon S1000pj puts a projector where no projector has gone before. Image quality is okay; video is lagging. The projector is a crowd-pleaser.

Reviews.Title: Great, unique camera
Reviews.Author: Siebenburgen
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Takes amazing pictures even in low light, has several presets for most situations you can possibly come across (museum, sunset, landscape, etc). The projector is very nice for sharing your pictures with friends, and the image is surprisingly crisp on a white wall in a dark room. The remote is very convenient. I am very happy with this unique camera and I would recommend it without reservations.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: In mi opinion is a very good product (it's a nikon's stuff) and the projector is awesome, I love it!

Reviews.Title: it's nice and everything work fine till i had to charge the battery, cause the charger came DOA, dead on arrive.
Reviews.Author: Ariman Sanchez "Cyberari"
Reviews.Content: Very well everything,it's easy to handle very fun.. wery well constructed, but when i did try to charge the battery the charger will not work what a nice suprise.. so ive to find a charger for this camera meanwhile i tried to solve the issue of the DOA.

Reviews.Title: Great but not so great
Reviews.Author: Phoncius "Phong"
Reviews.Content: At first, for just $130 (when I bought it) it was a great deal. The construction quality is good. It looks like a high-end camera. The build-in projector is amazing. It has worked well until now. Unfortunately, the only thing I was disappointed is picture quality. It was just not as good as other cameras that I used to own. The pictures looked poorly. The reasons that I bought this because I checked at Nikon official website, the original price was like 300-350 bucks, but now only $130. Wow!. I thought It shouldn't that bad as many people said on the preview so I gave it a try. Now I truly understand man, you get what you paid for. Secondly, I bought this one because of the build in projector feature. Honestly, it was awesome. It worked great more than my expectation.Bottom line, this camera is a good fit with people who not hang out a lot with their camera (not using much). You can show off with your friend about your build in projector feature. Sometimes, it becomes handy. For enthusiasms, it is not for you. You need to spend more money and to invest in a better camera with better picture quality.P.S. with $130 you cannot expect alot of things from it.

Reviews.Title: not all that
Reviews.Author: Herbert J. Fellows "glass enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: In short, the picture quality is ok, nothing to write home about. The projector really loses the picture after about 4 x 6. They say you can project up to 40" or something like that? Maybe, but you wouldn't be able to say what the picture was!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Joodle
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera about a week and I already love it!  I highly recommend & the price is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S1000pj 12.1MP Digital Camera with Built-In Projector and 5x Wide-Angle Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom
Reviews.Author: medo
Reviews.Content: This is a cool camera. If you know how to use it and change the scenes accordingly, you will get high quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Projection Camera
Reviews.Author: Monica Brooks
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for a projection camera when I ran across this one but am so glad I did! I take pictures for fun; therefore, I didn't need anything fancy. This camera is everything I need and want, with an added bonus of the projector.  The camera is simple to use and takes great pictures.  The projector is so much fun and works extremely well, even in well lit areas.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Wagner
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this little point and shoot camera.As for ease of use, it is simple and intuitive. If you haveused any digital before, you will be able to just pick thisup and start shooting.The projector is a great idea, and lots of fun.The picture quality is very good, as good asany simple point and shoot can expect to be.This is my third camera of this type and hands down my favorite ofthe three. It's simplicity of use makes it a great first camera foryoungsters or those who have never before made the move to digital.It is small and easy to tuck away in a pocket or bag.

Reviews.Title: Cool Stuff
Reviews.Author: ash
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that I got something which can take pictures (decent quality) and can freakin project them at the same time at $ 149 !Battery life sucks, I ordered an extra one, I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and projector really works.
Reviews.Author: Ash
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and the projector. Only thing I do not like is that it takes a lithium battery. I bought a spare just for that reason. I like the ease of just buying a pack of AA's, but the camera more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: features
Reviews.Author: Karl Dyksterhouse
Reviews.Content: Camera ia everything advertised and more. In fact there are features that I will probably never use!! It appears to be a great camera and easy to use for the limited use that I give it. Certainly worth the money I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S1000
Reviews.Author: Dreamzguy
Reviews.Content: With an inbuilt-projector , it take photography experience to the next level. Would recommend for ppl who watch pics with the family. My son loves it.However, it doesnot let other pics to be copied to the SD drive so that I can use those to view too.

Reviews.Title: great deal!
Reviews.Author: missmj
Reviews.Content: I just got the camera - free shipping and delivered in two days - thx Amazon!!! The quality is amazing! The price ($149) is even better! The projector works great even from 20 feet away! And it's Nikon - what else do you want?!?! ?! Highly recomended for every day (or ones-a-month) use camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Rocks
Reviews.Author: Robert Fleming "CEO, eMarketing Association"
Reviews.Content: Ok, a projector sounds a little wierd,but once you get this camera, you will change your mind.  First of all it is a great camera even if it didn't have the projector.  It takes great pictures and compares with many cameras selling for about 375 - 425, so might as well get the projector.  You will use it more than you think.  I love it! Buy this camera, you won't regret it.It is lightweight, small and has every feature you would want in a camera.  In a dark room you can project images up to about 65" and they look pritty good.

Reviews.Title: Please do not buy this product
Reviews.Author: priscilla
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these cameras for gifts. we needed to return one for repair with in a few months and it had been used very little. Just after the manufactures one year warrentee, both the cameras do not work. It was a waste of my hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about the projector,But when it came It was not able to focus!!! I had to return it!

Reviews.Title: Didn't last long enough to evaluate
Reviews.Author: William T. Hughes "Bill Hughes"
Reviews.Content: I used the camera  a few days, maybe 60 or so exposures before it malfunctioned. I returned it for a replacement, and the replacement was defective right of the box, I could not get another replacement; Amazon reported it "out of stock." I wonder why. I'm still awaiting for my refund to be processed. Nuff said?

Reviews.Title: False advertising?
Reviews.Author: MonicaR
Reviews.Content: What is this! I do a search for the camera and it appears with a price of $149 and when I click on it, the price is $249???

Reviews.Title: Buena camara, pesimo reflector
Reviews.Author: DnKiKe
Reviews.Content: La camara en si es buena, tiene multiples funciones y no pretende ser la super camara, es sencillamente para diversion y fotos de una calidad mediana - alta, lo que si es definitivamente regular es su proyector, de hecho es un artilugio mas tipo gadget que cualquier otra cosa......como dije anteriormente, solo para diversion y a oscuras.

Reviews.Title: Cool!!
Reviews.Author: Wen Qu
Reviews.Content: The projector is the most amazing thing with this camera. If there was a cover over the window of the projector, it would be perfect.I gave it a big 5!

Reviews.Title: S1000PJ terrible picture quality
Reviews.Author: Betta31
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about a year.  It takes terrible pictures.  I sent it back to Nikon to fix and it came back the same.. Projector is nice but the camera is terrible

Reviews.Title: Newest Nikon needs work
Reviews.Author: Big Daddy "Big Daddy"
Reviews.Content: This review is about the camera's built in projector. The camera itself is just fine. It works good and takes great pictures. This review is about the projector only. I am somewhat of an electronics junkie. I like most of the latest gagets and when I saw the Nikon s1000 I flipped. How cool to be able to project a photo you just took onto a wall. It would be so much better that trying to have everyone stand behind the camera and look at that tiny screen. Well, it is not much better. There are several things you need to consider before buying one. First, it is useless in the sunlight. You cannot see the image unless you shade it and then it is only slightly better. Two, you have to be about 5 to 6 feet from the wall. Farther than that and the picture blurs out too much to see detail. This becomes a real pain in that unless you live in a small travel trailer you do not usually have an available wall that close to show your pictures on so you have to stand up and go to the wall. Now everyone is standing for the entire slide show. Third, you need to have a wall! I never realized it but I have alot of pictures on my walls. I do not have many areas I can go to and project my picture on. Lastly, the wall has to be white. Any other color and it washes out your pictures details and color. I do not recommend this camera if you plan to use it as a projector. You would be better off hooking the camera to your TV for home viewing and for on the road just pass the camera around.

Reviews.Title: LCoS, not DLP= lower contrast, brighter black levels, less colorful
Reviews.Author: Jack "bdcu"
Reviews.Content: Granted you are not buying a projector, but I think I should point out why I decided against buying this camera.The projection engine is white LED through LCoS, not RGB LED over DLP, which is becoming popular in pico projectors. The latter gives you darker blacks and wider gamut of colors, plus better energy efficiency. A minor difference in context of the unique product (they're both too dim to impress, anyway), but a consideration nevertheless if you are buying it for the projector.

Reviews.Title: Not a solid build camera.
Reviews.Author: CircleBoy
Reviews.Content: nikon makes good cameras but this one fail on me.  the lcd flickers out of the box.  and makes ticking sound.  projection is cool.  however, i would still recommend to new buyer.btw; this camera is NOT make in Japan.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
World's first camera with an ultra-small, built-in projector provides new ways for enjoying your pictures anytime and anywhere
5x wide-angle Zoom-NIKKOR glass lens; 5-way VR image stabilization system
Bright 2.7-inch high-resolution LCD; Scene Auto Selector and Smart Portrait System
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix S1000pj 12.1MP Digital Camera with Built-In Projector and 5x Wide-Angle Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom
